content.body:
The Assets feature allows you to create a library of text, photo, and video content that can be applied to fields in the Knowledge Graph. This article provides instructions on how to add a video asset to your account. If you would like to add a different type of asset, visit [Add a Text Asset](https://help.yext.com/hc/en\-us/articles/115005994346\-Add\-a\-Text\-Asset) or [Add a Photo Asset](https://help.yext.com/hc/en\-us/articles/115005978303\-Add\-a\-Photo\-Asset).





1. Click **Knowledge Graph**in the navigation bar and click **Assets**.
2. Click on the **+ Add Asset** button, then click **Video**.
3. Enter a name for the video asset.
4. If applicable, select the **Language** of the asset.
5. Click **+ Add YouTube video**. A dialog box appears.
6. Enter the URL of the YouTube video. If you do not know the URL, click **Search YouTube**, then click **Select this video**.
7. Click **Add**.
8. (Optional) Enter an external **Description.**
9. Select the checkboxes next to the fields you would like this asset to be available for.
10. (Optional) Enter a **Description.** This is an internal\-only field that you can use to describe the asset.
11. (Optional) Add any **Labels** you want the asset to have.



    * Note: Asset labels can be used to restrict which assets are available to a custom field. To do so, add a specific label to the asset, then add the same label to the [custom field](https://help.yext.com/hc/en\-us/articles/360000000583).




12. (Optional) Select the entities that you would like to associate the asset with. Otherwise, it will be available to all entities by default.
13. Click **Save Asset** or **Save and Add Another**.

helpstarter_helpArticleBodyMarkdown.markdown:
The Assets feature allows you to create a library of text, photo, and video content that can be applied to fields in the Knowledge Graph. This article provides instructions on how to add a video asset to your account. If you would like to add a different type of asset, visit Add a Text Asset or Add a Photo Asset.

  1. Click Knowledge Graph in the navigation bar and click Assets.
  2. Click on the + Add Asset button, then click Video.
  3. Enter a name for the video asset.
  4. If applicable, select the Language of the asset.
  5. Click + Add YouTube video. A dialog box appears.
  6. Enter the URL of the YouTube video. If you do not know the URL, click Search YouTube, then click Select this video.
  7. Click Add.
  8. (Optional) Enter an external Description.
  9. Select the checkboxes next to the fields you would like this asset to be available for.
  10. (Optional) Enter a Description. This is an internal-only field that you can use to describe the asset.
  11. (Optional) Add any Labels you want the asset to have.
    • Note: Asset labels can be used to restrict which assets are available to a custom field. To do so, add a specific label to the asset, then add the same label to the custom field.
  12. (Optional) Select the entities that you would like to associate the asset with. Otherwise, it will be available to all entities by default.
  13. Click Save Asset or Save and Add Another.

keywords: how to add a video asset
content.name: Add a Video Asset
